home.title: AI Video Generation Platform
home.projectTitle: Discover an app that makes creating AI videos simple

p1.intro: Developed as an engineering thesis project by three students of the
p1.highlight2: prof. AGH dr hab. inż. Rafał Dreżewski
p1.end: . Project delivers a modern, scalable and highly available system for generating videos from text-combining the flexibility of open-source models with production-grade engineering.

p2.intro: At the core of the system lies a Python backend powered by
p2.middle1: , providing high-performance asynchronous endpoints, clean architecture, and fast request handling. All video generation tasks run in a distributed environment orchestrated by
p2.middle2: , enabling seamless scaling and parallel execution of multiple tasks through an actor-based model, where each generation process runs as an isolated actor maintaining its own state and executing computations independently. The AI layer utilizes
p2.middle3: models, extended with temporal modules to ensure motion consistency, frame coherence and high-quality video synthesis. The output is further enhanced by a

p3.intro: Application data is stored in a
p3.middle1: database, while all generated assets are managed through
p3.middle2: , a high-performance object storage system. Real-time communication is handled via
p3.end: , allowing users to watch a live preview of the generation process without refreshing the page. The frontend, built with Next.js, offers an intuitive interface for configuring parameters such as the negative prompt, chosen base model, motion intensity, stylistic preferences and more.

p4.intro: Users can download their videos, share them on social platforms, and explore outstanding community creations in the
p4.end: . The system also supports account deactivation and reactivation without losing stored data, giving users full control over their workspace.

description.cta: Ready to bring your ideas to life? Start generating your first AI video now.

instructions.title: Instructions
instructions.intro: Creating a high-quality video starts with a well-constructed prompt. In this panel, you can not only define your main description but also fine-tune all parameters that directly influence the appearance, pacing and overall style of your animation. The application gives you full control over the entire generation pipeline - from basic settings to advanced quality options.
instructions.promptsIntro: A good prompt is the foundation of a good video. Try to:
instructions.promptsTip1: be precise about what you want to see (objects, characters, locations),
instructions.promptsTip2: include stylistic hints such as realism, cinematic mood, animation, cyberpunk, painting-like,
instructions.promptsTip3: define lighting, atmosphere and camera shots (e.g. close-up, dolly zoom, panning),
instructions.promptsTip4: avoid vague descriptions - specificity gives the model clarity.
instructions.negativePromptInfo: If there are things you don't want in the video - noise, blur, deformed faces, compression, distortions - add them to the Negative Prompt. This tells the model what to exclude.
instructions.parametersIntro: Your video can be customized through the following parameters:
instructions.videoLengthDesc: Duration in seconds. Longer videos require more processing time.
instructions.aspectRatioHorizontal: 16:9 / 3:2 – horizontal, best for cinematic content and YouTube,
instructions.aspectRatioVertical: 2:3 / 9:16 – vertical, perfect for TikTok, Shorts and Reels.
instructions.resolutionLow: low resolutions are ideal for quick tests,
instructions.resolution4K: 4K offers the highest fidelity at the cost of significantly longer generation times.
instructions.inferenceStepsIntro: Defines how many denoising iterations the model performs:
instructions.inferenceStepsLow: low range (1–20): fast but less detailed,
instructions.inferenceStepsMedium: medium (25–40): the best balance between speed and quality,
instructions.guidanceScaleIntro: Defines how strongly the model follows your prompt during generation:
instructions.guidanceScaleLow: low range (0–2): more creative output but less prompt adherence,
instructions.guidanceScaleMedium: medium (2–6): the best balance between creativity and consistency,
instructions.guidanceScaleHigh: high (6–10): maximum prompt adherence with reduced creative freedom.
instructions.seedDesc: A numeric value that controls randomness in generation. Using the same seed with identical parameters will produce similar results, allowing you to reproduce or iterate on specific outcomes. Leave empty for completely random generation.
instructions.modelsTitle: Base Generation Models - what they are and how they differ
instructions.modelsIntro: The base model determines the overall style and visual identity of the generated video. Each model has its own strengths:
instructions.modelSD15Desc: Most universal and neutral baseline. Works well for general scenes and everyday environments. Easy to steer with prompts.
instructions.modelEpicRealismDesc: Focused on hyperrealistic, almost photographic quality. Excellent for cinematic shots and lifelike faces. Natural lighting and detailed textures.
instructions.modelRealisticVisionDesc: Outstanding for human portraits and character-centric scenes. Precise facial structure, skin textures and lighting. Ideal for close-up shots.
instructions.modelDreamShaperDesc: Creative, stylized and artistic. Perfect for fantasy, concept art, magical realism. Soft lighting and expressive style.
instructions.modelJuggernautDesc: Strong all-rounder model. Balanced mix of realism and visual punch. Great for action scenes and dynamic motion.
instructions.modelRevAnimatedDesc: Designed for animation-inspired aesthetics. Bold colors, expressive shapes, anime-hybrid style. Best for energetic scenes and stylized effects.

quick.title: Quick Generation
quick.promptTooltip: Describe what you want to see in the video
quick.lengthTooltip: Duration of the video in seconds
quick.lengthMin: Length must be at least 1 second

full.title: Full Generation
full.promptTooltip: Describe what you want to see in the video
full.lengthTooltip: Duration of the video in seconds
full.lengthMin: Length must be at least 1 second
full.negativePromptTooltip: Describe what you want to avoid in the video
full.inferenceStepsTooltip: More steps = better quality but longer time
full.inferenceStepsRange: Inference steps must be between 1 and 100
full.guidanceScaleTooltip: Controls how strongly the model follows your prompt. Higher values = more on-prompt, lower values = more creative but less consistent.
full.guidanceScaleRange: Guidance scale must be between 0 and 100
full.seedTooltip: Random seed for reproducible generation. Leave empty for random results
